an10.24:4.1: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetis at Sahajāti.
an10.24:5.1: “Reverends, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:
an10.24:5.2: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching.’
an10.24:5.3: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going. Or that hate …
an10.24:5.11: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:
an10.24:5.12: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
an10.24:5.13: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …
an10.24:5.21: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
an10.24:6.1: A mendicant who makes a declaration of development says:
an10.24:6.2: ‘I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
an10.24:6.3: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going. Or that hate …
an10.24:6.11: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:
an10.24:6.12: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
an10.24:6.13: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …
an10.24:6.21: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
an10.24:7.1: A mendicant who makes a declaration of both knowledge and development says:
an10.24:7.2: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching. And I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’
an10.24:7.3: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going. Or that hate …
an10.24:7.11: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

an10.24:7.13: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …
an10.24:7.21: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
an10.24:8.1: Suppose a poor, needy, and penniless person was to declare themselves to be to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.
an10.24:8.2: But when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.
an10.24:8.3: Then they would know of them:
an10.24:8.4: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, but they are in fact poor, penniless, and needy.’
an10.24:8.6: Because when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.
